Sentence.sentence: Travel was arduous and costly throughout the period, possible only for a privileged class—the same that produced gentlemen scientists, authors, antique experts, and patrons of the arts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Contrary to analysts' doubts, the author believes drug prices may be lowered through negotiation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The  study's  authors  surveyed  12,395  students  and  analyzed  nine  risk  behaviors,  including  excessive  alcohol use, illegal drug use, heavy smoking, high media use and truancy ( ' ,  逃学 ).
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Essentially, I could not agree more with the authors, said Svante Pääbo, a biologist and director of the Max  Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology in Germany.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Because  their  behaviors are not usually seen as a red flag, these young people have been dubbed the invisible risk group by the  study's authors.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: says Dr.Robert Cialdini, author of Influence: The Psychology of Persuasion.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Laura Hamilton, the author of a study on parents who pay for college, will argue in a forthcoming book that college administrations arc overly concerned with the social and athletic activities of their students.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: All the forecasts, plans, and anticipations cited above have failed so miserably because their authors and promoters thought the transitions they hoped to implement would proceed unlike all previous energy transitions, and that their progress could be accelerated in an unprecedented manner.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Nicholas Carr, author of The Shallows: What the Internet Is Doing to Our Brains, wrote, "The net is designed to be an interruption system, a machine geared to dividing attention."
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Laura Hamilton, the author of a study on parents who pay for college, will argue in a forthcoming book that college administrations are overly concerned with the social and athletic activities of their students.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Regardless of the author, it seems that the poem was inspired by a real event.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: So I started practicing the various practical steps mentioned by the author in the book, and began to revolt against the very idea of being too busy.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The author believes the researchers’ new study has gone a step further regarding the impact of screen time on well-being.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"作者，作家"之意。
means: author ：泛指用自己名字或笔名发表过作品的人，不强调是否以写作为主职业。
writer ：含义广泛，一般指以写作为职业的人。

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表名词,主要表示"人或物器"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 前辈,前任,[被取代的]原有事物
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre前+de+cess走+or人→前面走过的人→前辈
act行动,行为,扮演+or人或物器→n.男演员,行动者,参与者
aggress侵略,进攻+or人或物器→n.侵略者,攻击者
arbitrate仲裁,公断+or人或物器→n.仲裁人,公断者
auth+or人或物器→n.作家,创造者
collect收集+or人或物器→n.收藏家,征收者
compress挤压+or人或物器→n.压缩机
conquer征服,战胜+or人或物器→n.征服者,胜利者
create创作+or人或物器→n.创造者,创作者
credit贷款+or人或物器→n.债权人
designate指定+or人或物器→n.指示者,指定者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发现者,侦察器,探测器,检波器,检电器
stems_affixes.word_buile: detect察觉,发觉+or人或物器→n.发现者,侦察器,探测器,检波器,检电器
educate教育+or人或物器→educator教育家
execute执行+or人或物器→n.遗嘱执行人,执行者
gladiate剑状的+or人或物器→n.角斗士,与野兽搏斗者
indicate指示+or人或物器→n.指示器,[化]指示剂
ment精神+or人或物器→n.导师
moderate中等的+or人或物器→n.调解人,仲裁人
oppress压迫,压制+or人或物器→n.压迫者
past+or人或物器→原来是拉丁文"牧羊人"的意思
process过程,处理+or人或物器→n.处理机,处理器
proct监督+or人或物器→n.代理人,学监
project投射出+or人或物器→n.放映机

stems_affixes.value_cn: 海员,水手,不大会晕船的人,船员
stems_affixes.word_buile: sail航行+or人或物器→n.海员,水手,不大会晕船的人,船员

stems_affixes.value_cn: 继承者,接任者,后续的事物
stems_affixes.word_buile: success成功,胜利+or人或物器→继续着别人的成功→继承者,接任者
vend出售+or人或物器→n.小贩

mean.mean: （尤指计划或思想的）创造者，发起人

entry.def: The author of a piece of writing is the person who wrote it.

example.ex: ...Jill Phillips, author of the book 'Give Your Child Music'.
example.tran: 吉尔·菲利普斯，《给孩子音乐》一书的作者

entry.def: An author is a person whose job is writing books.

example.ex: Haruki Murakami is Japan's best-selling author.
example.tran: 村上春树是日本当红的畅销书作家。

entry.def: The author of a plan or proposal is the person who thinks of it and works out the details.
entry.tran: (计划或建议的）筹划者，制定者

example.ex: The authors of the plan believe they can reach this point within about two years.
example.tran: 该计划的提出者相信他们约在两年内可以达成该目标。

entry.def: To author something means to be the author of it.

example.ex: Then he opened a restaurant, authored a book, and landed his own radio show.
example.tran: 后来他开了个餐馆，写了本书，还制作了自己的广播剧。

example.ex: ...a proposal authored by subcommittee chairman Quentin Burdick.
example.tran: 专门小组委员会主席昆廷·伯迪克提出的建议

means.word_mean: 1. writes (books or stories or articles or the like) professionally (for pay)
2. someone who originates or causes or initiates something;

sentences.sentence: "he was the generator of several complaints"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (in the sense 'a person who invents or causes something'): from Old French autor, from Latin auctor, from augere 'increase, originate, promote'. The spelling with th arose in the 15th cent., and perhaps became established under the influence of authentic

sentences.cn: 作者把自己的思想感情寄托在剧中主人翁身上.
sentences.en: The author projects his own thoughts and feelings into the personality of the hero of his play.

sentences.cn: 作者在他的著作出版之前就逝世了.
sentences.en: The author died before his book had seen the light.

sentences.cn: 作者发现译者偷偷在他的原著中插入了几段.
sentences.en: The author discovered that the translator had foisted several passages into his book.

sentences.cn: 作者是谁？
sentences.en: Who's the author?

sentences.cn: 吉尔·菲利普斯，《给孩子音乐》一书的作者
sentences.en: ...Jill Phillips, author of the book 'Give Your Child Music'.

sentences.cn: 《开放的思维》一书的作者多娜·马可娃说：“创新的第一要务就是强烈的好奇心。”
sentences.en: “The first thing needed for innovation is a fascination with wonder,” says Dawna Markova, author of “The Open Mind”.

sentences.cn: “打破了美国信仰体系中的重要原则——每个人都无所不能”，2006年出版的新书《今年我会……》的作者M.J.赖恩解释说。同时，赖恩也是马可娃女士的生意伙伴。
sentences.en: “This breaks the major rule in the American belief system — that anyone can do anything,” explains M.J. Ryan, author of the 2006 book “This Year I Will...” and Ms. Markova's business partner.

sentences.cn: 浪漫派作家通过突出刻画艺术家们的个人经历而非社会荣耀来纪念同时期的重要画家和作者。
sentences.en: The Romantics commemorated the leading painters and authors of their day, stressing the uniqueness of the artist's personal experience rather than public glory.

sentences.cn: 作者亚当•戴维森在《在美国制造》一文中讲述了一个从产棉区听到的笑话，说的是现代纺织厂的自动化程度：如今的普通工厂只有两个雇员，“一个人和一条狗。
sentences.en: In an essay entitled “Making It in America”, the author Adam Davidson relates a joke from cotton country about just how much a modern textile mill has been automated: The average mill has only two employees today, “a man and a dog.

sentences.cn: 并非所有人都会赞同作者从“增加假日时间”到 “降低对美国购房者的税收刺激”等政策理念。
sentences.en: Not everyone will agree with the authors' policyideas, which range from mandating more holiday time to reducing tax incentives for American home buyers.

sentences.cn: 然而，著有《拉动力》以及其他著作的作者约翰·哈格尔认为布伦乔尔森与迈克菲二人忽视了这些工作会如此轻而易举地被技术所取代的根本原因。
sentences.en: And yet, John Hagel, author of The Power of Pull and other books, says Brynjolfsson and McAfee miss the reason why these jobs are so vulnerable to technology in the first place.

sentences.cn: 论文的作者来自不同的大学。他们的发现基于一项研究,该研究的对象涉及到一所未著名的私立大学的147名学生(他们均完成了该项目)。
sentences.en: The authors of the paper are from different universities, and their findings are based on a study involving 147 students (who completed the project) at an unnamed private university.

sentences.cn: 他们引用了数位作者的已有研究说明,这正是弥合成就差距所必须缩小的缺口。
sentences.en: They cite past research by several authors to show that this is the gap that must be narrowed to close the achievement gap.

sentences.cn: 为了防止过于重视忙碌的工作状态，《深度工作：在充满干扰的世界里专注成功的守则》一书的作者卡尔·纽波特建议养成“深度工作”的习惯，即一种摒除干扰、集中注意力的能力。
sentences.en: To combat the trap of putting a premium on being busy, Cal Newport, author of Deep work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted world, recommends building a habit of "deep work"—the ability to focus without distraction.

sentences.cn: 《影响力：说服力的心理学分析》的作者 RobertCialdini 博士认为：“社会规范是最为原始和基本的。
sentences.en: “ Social norms are  primitive and elemental, ” says Dr. Robert Cialdini, author of  Influence :  The Psychology of Persuasion .
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 这些作者在《哈佛商业评论》中写道，在某种程度上，这种模式可能与工作方式有关，在过去几十年里工作方式已经改变了。
sentences.en: In part, the authors wrote in HBR, this pattern may have to do with the way work itself has changed over the past several decades.

sentences.cn: 杜克大学的James Burke 是一项研究的作者之一，这项研究回顾了以前有关认知能力下降的研究。
sentences.en: James Burke of Duke University is one of the authors of a study reviewing previous research on cognitive decline.

sentences.cn: 第一作者Liat Tikotzky 在一封电子邮件中说，研究团队也没有调查爸爸的睡眠。所以他们的睡眠模式也有可能打扰了妈妈的睡眠。
sentences.en: Lead author Liat Tikotzky wrote in an email that the research team also didn’t measure fathers’ sleep, so it’s possible that their sleep patterns could also be causing the sleep disruptions for moms

Sentence.sentence: In post-war Japan, the economy wasn’t doing so great, so you couldn’t get everyday-use items like household cleaners, says Lisa Katayama, author of Urawaza, a book named after the Japanese term for clever lifestyle tips and tricks, So people looked for ways to do with what they had.
